STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 14, 2025
Julie Waldron
CHEBOYGAN/PRESQUE ISLE COUNTY DHHS
827 S HURON ST,
CHEBOYGAN, MI, 49721-2209
RE: License#: CP160201035
Dear Ms. Waldron:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 7/11/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of three files reviewed documented a late Updated Service Plan. The report
was due 2/25/2025 and was completed 3/03/2025.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was provided technical assistance regarding the timely uploading
of Parent Agency Treatment Plan (PATP) signature pages. Two PATP's were
completed with signatures on time however there was a delay in uploading
them.
• The agency was informed that DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS policy.
Audits will involve the auditing of DCWL rules (Pink Book) only.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting that
the foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and other
relevant parities and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan would
meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.

V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 9/04/2024 in response to
two violations established during the 6/12/2024 Interim Inspection. The violations
were R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy, and FOM 722-08D Treatment
Plans. The current Renewal Inspection did not establish any repeat violations
therefore indicating the CAP was successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The assessment details the
agency efforts to achieve CAP compliance. The assessment also addressed
barriers to compliance with policy and rules. Barriers included staff turnover as
well as document uploading requirements and extra parenting time supervision.
The agency currently has a staff vacancy and the licensing worker has had to
assist with carrying a partial caseload. The assessment also identified the new
CWLM system as an additional challenge. One disrupted placement was
addressed and discussed the high mental health needs of the child involved.
The assessment was well written and very thorough as it addressed all areas the
document asks for.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office. Financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported enjoying working for the agency. They reported that
supervision is very supportive of them and easily assessable. Staff further
reported that they are part of a supportive team and that makes their job easier.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern building in Cheboygan. There is sufficient office
space and the facility is well maintained. CHRI documents were observed to be
secured as required.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified one safety concern during her visits to the homes and it
is as follows:
Safety Alert #1 A safety alert was generated on 5-8-25 as an unlicensed home was
missing a smoke alarm between the master bedroom and the rest of the house. A
smoke alarm was also missing between the children's bedroom and the rest of the
house.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 5-12-2025 as alarms were installed and
photos provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
July 11, 2025
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 14, 2025
